ovdesc.p: This parameter file is the central point of control for the derivatives module.
Information from here either, controls, or is inherited by other applications in the derivatives module.

desc.p: If it is 1 or null then costprice in sc.pos.asset will be calculated as COST.PRICE = PRICE + (COMMISSION.AMOUNT / NOMINALS) , If it is 2 then costprice will be calculated as COST.PRICE = ((PRICE * CONTRACT.SIZE) + (COMMISSION.AMOUNT / NOMINALS) / CONTRACT.SIZE).
Values
1 , 2 or NULL
If the checking of a customers availibility of funds is required enter 'YES' otherwise enter 'NO'
3 Characters YES/NO

Where Margin payments are reversed and re-booked each day, if this option is set to YES, each of the reversal entries for the suspense accounts are put through the exact suspense account from which they are being reversed, regardless of direction, otherwise all DRs are put through the DR suspense account and all CRs are put through the CR suspense account.
If the suspense accounts are set up such that both debits and credits go through the same account, then this parameter has no effect on the system.

If specified, this API will be invoked during valuation of a futures position as reported in SC.POS.ASSET and associated valuation tables.
The arguments passed to the API are ESTIMATION.VAL,MARKET.PRICE,INT.COST.PRICE,NO.LOTS,R.DX.CONTRACT.MASTER
ESTIMATION.VAL is to be returned by the API as the estimated valuation in trade currency in internal T24 format
MARKET.PRICE is the current market price of the futures contract in trade currency, passed to the API in internal T24 format
INT.COST.PRICE is the cost price of this position in trade currency, passed to the API in internal T24 format
NO.LOTS is the number of lots held in this position, passed to the API
CONTRACT.SIZE is the contract size as held on the corresponding DX.CONTRACT.MASTER record, passed to the API
Please note that this API is not invoked during valuation of an option.

This field specifies if the system should post initial and variation amounts to a separate "margin" account or to the customers "normal" account.

If this field is set to YES then all initial and variation margin postings created by an End OF Exchange or End Of Day revaluations will be posted to the margin account, specified in the associated MARGIN.ACC.CCY and MARGIN.ACCOUNT fields in the DX.CUSTOMER application. If this field is set to NO then the initial and variation margin amount will be posted to the normal customer accounts.
Setting this field to yes enables the use of the maintenance margin facility to reduce the payments required by a customer.
Up to a 3 character field.
Must be one of YES or NO
Default to NO
If specified, this API will be invoked during closeout/exercise/expire/assignment of the DX.TRADE. The API has one argument, the DX.CLOSEOUT record, as a dynamic array.

The purpose of this API is to update the TAX.CODE, TAX.TYPE, TAX.ACY and TAX.TCY fields on the DX.CLOSEOUTrecord. Any changes to other fields on the DX.CLOSEOUT record by the API will be ignored by the core processing.
Please note that the settings of these fields do not affect the values input into the DX.TRADE tax fields, as theseonly affect tax liable at trade inception.

This field specifies the PRICE.SET that will be checked to ensure all the prices required for the end of exchange revaluation have been updated. When the end of exchange process is started any prices in this set required for revaluation that are not present or have not been updated on the run date will be listed in a warning report.
Input must be a valid price set.
Up to 15 characters. Multivalue field associated with DX.PRICE.SET application.
Mandatory input.
A valid routine should be selected, this can be tested using DX.GET.OBJECT the object should be attached to the application DX.ORDER.
Input must be a valid record on DX.OBJECT.LIBRARY
This field defines how the system should calculate the average price of a position. The average price is shown on reports and enquires for each specific contract held by a customer.
There are three methods that can be used to calculate the average price. These are
NORMAL Weighted average of absolute value of prices of trades in position; weighted by number of lots traded
UNWEIGHTED Straight average of absolute value of prices of trades in position by number of trades
PURCHASE Average of buy prices in position only; weighted by the number of lots traded.
4. NONE
No average price will be calculated. This will apply mainly for options with deferred premium payments and for futures contracts, as average price is not applicable.
5. OPENING
Note. In phase one of the module only NORMAL is supported.
Up to 10 character field.
Must be one of NORMAL, UNWEIGHTED, PURCHASE, NONE AND OPENING

The Derivatives module offers the ability to choose two styles of contingent asset/liability posting for own-book trading.The DX.PARAMETER field CONT.ULYING.VAL has the following effect:
If CONT.ULYING.VAL is set to "NO":
Existing style - Only for futures and options with premium unposted
For Forex Derivatives (DX.CONTRACT.MASTER DELIVERY.METHOD = "CASH") - CR or DB CRF asset type Amount - cost of position or contingent value currency - contract currency
For all other Derivatives - CR or DB CRF asset type Amount - cost of position or contingent value Currency - contract currency
If CONT.ULYING.VAL is set to "YES":
New style for all trades

For Forex Derivatives (DX.CONTRACT.MASTER DELIVERY.METHOD = "CASH") - CR CRF asset type Amount - underlying receivable ccy amount currency - receivable currency DB CRF Amount - underlying payable ccy amount currency - payable currency
For all other Derivatives - CR and DB CRF asset type Amount - cost of position currency - contract currency
The CRF asset types used are:
DXFUTBUY
DXFUTSELL
DXOPTBUY
DXOPTSELL
3 Characters, YES/NO

This field dictates which value is associated to a trade to update the Limits system.
Contingent Calculates a value for the trade using CONTINGENT.VALUE specified in DX.CONTRACT.MASTER number of lots * contingent value

As well as the standard method of posting the calculated Variation margin (P&L Category in the currency of the contract), several choices are available:
PL (default) - P&L calculated in contract currency. Posted to P&L Category in DX.EVENT.TYPE "VM"
PLLCCY - P&L calculated in contract currency, then converted to Local Currency Posted to P&L Category in DX.EVENT.TYPE "VM"
PLRP - P&L calculated in contract currency. Posted to P&L Category in DX.EVENT.TYPE "VM" Sign reversed, posted to Premium Payment account (maintains "replacement value")

PLLCCYRP - P&L calculated in contract currency, then converted to Local Currency Posted to P&L Category in DX.EVENT.TYPE "VM" Sign reversed, posted to Premium Payment account in Premium ccy (maintains "replacement value")
Choose from PL, PLLCCY, PLRP or PLLCCYRP

This field defines how the system should post initial and variation margins. If this field is set to YES then when a new margin figure has been calculated, the difference between the previous margin amount and the new amount will be posted. If this field is set to NO then the previous margin amount will be reversed and the new margin amount will be posted.
Margins are only posted during the End Of Exchange or the End Of Day processing, other re-valuations will report the new margin figures but no postings are created.
3 character either YES/ NO

The allowed values are PROFIT.LOSS and OPTION.VALUE. When set to PROFIT.LOSS the difference between trade and market cost is posted. When set as OPTION.VALUE the entire market cost is posted on the first day. This gets defaulted to DX.CONTRACT.MASTER.

The allowed values are ADJUST and REBOOK. When set to ADJUST the difference between pevious day and todays MTM amount is posted as entry. Whereas when set to REBOOK the previously posted MTM is reversed and the new MTM amount is posted.This gets defaulted to DX.CONTRACT.MASTER.
